desc: RRAGC, an mTORC1 activator, is mutated in follicular lymphomas.

The RRAGC gene encodes a guanine-binding protein of the RAG family of GTPases; it acts as a heterodimer with RRAGCA or RRAGCB (PMID: 24095279). RRAGC targets mTORC1, a complex that responds to growth factors and various other stimuli to positively regulate cell growth that is frequently deregulated in cancer. Specifically, RRAGC regulates the intracellular localization of mTORC1 and facilitates its RHEB-dependent activation (PMID: 20381137, 27234373). RRAGC missense mutations are found in follicular lymphomas (PMID: 26691987).

articles.title: Ragulator-Rag complex targets mTORC1 to the lysosomal surface and is necessary for its activation by amino acids.
articles.reference: Sancak Y et al. Cell. 2010 Apr 16;141(2)290-303.

articles.title: Recurrent mTORC1-activating RRAGC mutations in follicular lymphoma.
articles.reference: Okosun J et al. Nature genetics. 2016 Feb;48(2)183-8.

articles.title: The folliculin tumor suppressor is a GAP for the RagC/D GTPases that signal amino acid levels to mTORC1.
articles.reference: Tsun ZY et al. Molecular cell. 2013 Nov 21;52(4)495-505.

articles.title: De novo RRAGC mutation activates mTORC1 signaling in syndromic fetal dilated cardiomyopathy.
articles.reference: Long PA et al. Human genetics. 2016 Aug;135(8)909-917.
